Articles.Content:
I have not been able to do this for a while, so I am coming to the forum with it. I have assembled a duna ship in orbit. It will probably fail spectacularly, but whatever. I am going to post a quicksave, and I would very much appreciate it if someone could add an antennae to the science lab (which I simply forgot to do, and since I am such a noob and do not have a quicksave before construction, only want to do as many dockings as necessary. Thanks!

Link to Dropbox -

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/2td2xw13pkl4nf7?oref=e&r=AAKmp0nD-Ha-qTZizcj3b2OFpKM6zqyAHS8xYOCoPy5cdZO0jHfvoJ0McMQ4gwsV3YbEbMkS8fvuONWGSJrZdV_lD3FffvkQorMWE71aU_DQzAYHT9TO0UGy4-zqC5eh0rUTJCkJWEWwRGD9m_ga8eQAsCBiI4uNdbNmUh4t3vXA-dItmOJQ45QI5owZLBfzxDQ&sm=1

I'd suggest using Hyper Edit to bring the vessel back, recover it, then modify it, and put it back where it belongs.

As far as editing the config file of the ship to add an antennae I have no clue and can't help you. Best of luck!

Here is what you do.

Take the original complete craft file (found in the saves - VAB or SPH sub folder) and copy it over to a sandbox game (VAB or SPH sub folder). If it is station assembly, use the segment that has the desired part for the mating antenna. Add the antenna as the LAST part of the assembly. Name this craft with a unique ship name and make note of it. For the sake of time, use Hyperedit to put the full craft in space.  Stage the craft down to the state it is in orbit.  Now you can look in the persistant.sfs (a text file) and search for your ship name.  Within the VESSEL { } section find the PART { } section information for the antenna you added.  You can then copy the text for this and insert it into the VESSEL { } section in your persistant.sfs file of your main game. Grab "PART {all the part info is within the braces}" MAKE SURE YOU BACKUP YOUR PERSISTANT FILE!!!  I would suggest making two backups and write protect one so you cannot accidentally overwrite it.
